message.content:
We start by extracting the necessary values from the input:

1. From the Balance Sheet:
 • Total Current Assets = 7,000,260.27  
 • Total Current Liabilities = 1,601,835.08  
 • Total Assets = 12,566,098.56  
 • Total Liabilities = 1,601,835.08  
 • Cash on Hand = 376,598.62  
 • Bank Deposits = 100,482.62  
  → Total Cash = 376,598.62 + 100,482.62 = 477,081.24  

2. From the Income Statement:
 • Gross Profit = 1,136,701.10  
 • Total Revenue = 6,836,701.10  
 • Net Profit = –2,035,736.52  

3. From the Cash Flow Statement:
 • Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –6,856,840.58  
 • Purchase of Fixed Assets (capital expenditure) = 666,078.18  
  → Free Cash Flow (FCF) = Operating Cash Flow – Capital Expenditures = –6,856,840.58 – 666,078.18 = –7,522,918.76  

Now we calculate the required ratios:

A. Current Ratio  
 = Total Current Assets / Total Current Liabilities  
 = 7,000,260.27 / 1,601,835.08  
 ≈ 4.37

B. Gross Profit Margin  
 = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100  
 = (1,136,701.10 / 6,836,701.10) × 100  
 ≈ 16.63%

C. Debt to Asset Ratio  
 = Total Liabilities / Total Assets  
 = 1,601,835.08 / 12,566,098.56  
 ≈ 0.13

D. Net Profit Margin  
 = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100  
 = (–2,035,736.52 / 6,836,701.10) × 100  
 ≈ –29.77%

E. Cash to Current Debt Ratio  
 = Total Cash / Total Current Liabilities  
 = 477,081.24 / 1,601,835.08  
 ≈ 0.30

F. Free Cash Flow (FCF)  
 = –7,522,918.76  
  (derived above)

G. Return on Assets (ROA)  
 = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100  
 = (–2,035,736.52 / 12,566,098.56) × 100  
 ≈ –16.20%

Thus, the final answer is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Current Ratio": "4.37",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "16.63%",
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.13",
    "Net Profit Margin": "-29.77%",
    "Cash to Current Debt Ratio": "0.30",
    "Free Cash Flow (FCF)": "-7522918.76",
    "Return on Assets (ROA)": "-16.20%"
  }
}
